text: Andreas Neocleous Evripidi (; born 3 July 1939) is a Cypriot lawyer and a former member of the House of Representatives of Cyprus. Neocleous participated in EOKA's fight for the liberation of the island, and he was arrested by the British troops and imprisoned during 1956–1959.Who's Who. Επίτομο Βιογραφικό Λεξικό, Αθήνα, Μέτρον, Τόμος Β', 2009 In 1970, he was elected as a member of the Parliament of the United Party (Eniaion Party) in Cyprus. In 2019, Neocleous bought the Cyprus Mail, and the following day all articles relating to his having previously been found guilty of bribing deputy attorney general Rikos Erotokritou were removed from its website. ==Education== Neocleous graduated from National and Kapodistrian University of Athens Law School in 1964. He began practising law in 1965 and has specialized in the fields of international investment and international corporate tax law. He was the founder and managing partner of Andreas Neocleous & Co LLC Neocleous is one of only five Honorary Fellows of the Center for International Legal Studies. He is the Honorary Consul of Japan in Cyprus and the Honorary Legal Adviser of the British High Commissioner in Cyprus.http://ukincyprus.fco.gov.uk/resources/en/pdf/541790282/lawyers-south ==References== Category:1939 births Category:Living people Category:Cypriot lawyers Category:National and Kapodistrian University of Athens alumni Category:Members of the House of Representatives (Cyprus) Category:Cypriot people of the EOKA Category:Law firm founders Category:Greek Cypriot people Category:People from Paphos District
title: Andreas Neocleous
